Our government is a democracy. It is supposed to be by the people and for the people. God has dominion over all things including our government. God has allowed the laws that support abortion. Why? Well, that is for speculation but I'd say that it is simply a result of a fallen world. I see nothing wrong with citizens who are Christians use our rights and be active in our government to protect life. Maybe the word abortion does not appear in the Bible but it is clear that murder is wrong. We have laws that punish those who murder. I really do not believe that a woman has a right to abort that if a law preventing the majority of abortions were to be created that somehow this law would be taking away a right belonging to a woman.
 
 I'm hoping that will help make it clear why my stance is what it is on abortion and that you too might see what I'm explaining. If you feel we should discuss this further then by all means... lets open another thread.
But what if a so-called Christian takes a position which is non-christian (such as yours)? What then? BTW, check Exodus 21:22-23 for the only Biblical position regarding induced miscarriage or abortion.
